prompt: <description>Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a pointed bottom. The prism has a flat base and is slightly tilted to the right. Part 1: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. In the sketch, create the following curves and loops: a. Create line 1 from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.0, 0.038). b. Create arc 1 starting from point (0.0, 0.038), with a mid point at (0.0665, 0.1044), and ending at point (0.0, 0.1709). c. Create line 2 from point (0.0, 0.1709) to point (0.0, 0.2089). d. Create arc 2 starting from point (0.0, 0.2089), with a mid point at (0.1044, 0.1044), and ending at point (0.0, 0.0). Note: Loop 1 consists of line 1, arc 1, line 2, and arc 2. 4. Close loop 1 since it is always closed. 5. Create face 1 by connecting loop 1. 6. Create face 2 by copying face 1. The sketch should now contain two identical faces, each having one loop consisting of four curves. 7. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.2089. 8. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it around the Z-axis by an angle of 0.0 degrees, the X-axis by an angle of 0.0 degrees, and the Y-axis by an angle of 0.0 degrees, and then translating it by a vector of (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 9. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.1899 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal directions to generate the 3D model. The height, width, and length of part 1 and the final shape are as follows: - Height: 0.1899 - Width: 0.2089 - Length: 0.2089</description>
